title: Antarctica
description: During the peak of austral summer, from December to February, jewel-toned patches of water form atop the snow and ice on the Antarctic Peninsula. Such melting is usually spurred by the heat of the Sun, an indication that the seasonal melt is underway. But new research shows how the Sun is not the only reason for melt on the ice surface.
